titles.title: National Flood Insurance Program Reauthorization Act of 2004
A bill to extend the national flood insurance program.
National Flood Insurance Program Reauthorization Act of 2004
National Flood Insurance Program Reauthorization Act of 2004

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.
Senate Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Housing and Community Opportunity.
Mr. Oxley asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Message on House action received in Senate and at desk: House amendment to Senate bill.

vote.text: Senate agreed to the House amendment by Unanimous Consent.

reference.label: text as Senate agreed to House amendment

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.name: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

bill.summary: National Flood Insurance Program Reauthorization Act of 2004 - Amends the National Flood Insurance Act of 1968 to extend through March 31, 2004: (1) the authority to enter into new flood insurance contracts under the national flood insurance program; (2) the authority under which the Director of the Federal Emergency Management Agency may issue notes and other obligations to the Secretary of the Treasury for the purpose of carrying out the program; (3) requirements for carrying out emergency implementation of the program; and (4) the authorization of appropriations for carrying out studies under the Act.
